name: N-(3-chlorophenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4014
Reason: 3-Chlorophenyl group: The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The phenyl group also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant increase in molecular weight and van der Waals forces, estimated at +20°C. The fluorine atoms also contribute to the melting point due to their high electronegativity, estimated at +10°C each.
